title: 110_hr4097
content:
SECTION 1. FINDINGS. Congress finds that Identification Friend or Foe equipment is crucial for the Armed Forces to operate effectively in various conditions. Glo-patches and similar equipment must be destroyed to prevent restoration. Regulations prohibit the export of such equipment without permission, yet surplus combat uniforms with glo-tape patches were mistakenly sold in 2006. In July 2006, the Department of Defense determined that patches on combat uniforms had to be removed and destroyed before sale. In June 2007, it was found that Identification Friend or Foe equipment could easily be obtained in the US. In January 2007, Iraqi insurgents disguised as US soldiers killed one soldier and abducted four others, showing the dangers of enemy disguise. The Department of Defense prohibits the sale or donation of Identification Friend or Foe equipment and accessories. The Department of Defense prohibits the sale, resale, or donation of Identification Friend or Foe equipment and accessories, except for sales to members of the armed forces for personal use or donations to museums for historical preservation. The Department of Defense prohibits the sale, resale, or donation of Identification Friend or Foe equipment and accessories, except for sales to members of the armed forces for personal use or donations to museums for historical preservation. The Secretary of Defense must ensure that the prohibition is prominently displayed on any media allowing private purchase of surplus military equipment. Identification Friend or Foe equipment or accessory is defined as systems designed for identifying armed forces members in poor lighting conditions. The Department of Defense prohibits the sale, resale, or donation of Identification Friend or Foe equipment and accessories, except for sales to members of the armed forces for personal use or donations to museums for historical preservation. Systems designed for identifying armed forces members in poor lighting conditions are included in this prohibition. SEC. 3. PROHIBITION ON UNAUTHORIZED POSSESSION OF IDENTIFICATION FRIEND OR FOE EQUIPMENT AND ACCESSORIES.

Amends Section 701 of title 18, United States Code to prohibit the manufacture, sale, or possession of Identification Friend or Foe equipment or accessories without authorization. Defines such equipment as systems designed for identifying armed forces members in poor lighting conditions. The amendments made by this section will be effective 30 days after the enactment of this Act.
